attributes.action: Parliament to reject any bill resulting in  UK ceasing to be a member of the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
The fall in the Stock Markets in the UK and around the world means the UK is poorer by the same amount of contributions to the EC for over 15 years. Racial tensions have grown since the referendum was called. Britain's position has been reduced to that of a minor power.

It is still not too late to undo the damage and for the country to survive and come out of this crisis stronger if Parliament will now do its duty to serve the national interest.
attributes.background: The EC Referendum, called unecessarily for party political reasons, has resulted in the gravest crisis since the Second World War threatening Jobs, Pensions, the unity of the UK and Britain's position in the world. Over 49% of the electorate voted to remain including a majority in Scotland.
